title: Understanding the Basics of International Trade Through Storytelling

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental economic concepts and digital device usage capabilities
context.additional_context: Design considerations for middle-aged and older adult learners adapting to online learning post-COVID-19, accounting for potential internet connectivity instability

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain fundamental international trade procedures (import/export, customs clearance, payments) based on storyboard-driven real-world cases with over 80% accuracy
Learners analyze trade dispute resolution strategies through asynchronous learning materials in storytelling formats and apply them to hypothetical case studies
Learners complete trade scenario-based projects using digital platforms (e.g., Sway) and provide peer feedback through evaluations

resources: Microsoft Sway or Similar Digital Storytelling Tool License
Zoom Account for Live Lectures and Recording System
PDF Trade Terminology Glossary for Learners

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
